required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Low Level Laser Therapy for Late Postoperative Pain After Lumbar Fusion Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Low Level Laser Therapy for Late Postoperative Pain After Lumbar Fusion Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Toledo Health Science Campus

clinical_study.source: University of Toledo Health Science Campus

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to assess whether or not low level laser therapy (LLLT) decreases pain in post-operative orthopedic patients following lumbar fusion surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: Lumbar fusion surgery patients typically experience significant post-operative pain for several weeks and their rehabilitation does not start until 8 - 12 weeks postoperatively. We hypothesize that LLLT beginning 4 weeks postoperatively will provide significant reduction in postoperative pain.

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline (2 weeks after surgery), then 6,12, and 24 weeks from baseline

primary_outcome.measure: Oswestry Low Back Pain Disability (ODQ) Questionnaire
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline visit (2 weeks after the patient's surgery date) then 6,12, and 24 weeks thereafter

primary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life - The Quality of Life Short-Form Survey (SF-36)
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline visit (2 weeks after the patient's surgery date) then 6,12, and 24 weeks thereafter

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline (2 weeks after surgery), then 6,12, and 24 weeks from baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement measured by serial photographs of surgery appearance and rate of healing
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 weeks after surgery, then 6, 12, and 24 weeks after surgery

arm_group.description: No Laser done. All outcome measures are the same.

intervention.description: Low Level Laser Therapy done after surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
- Age > 18 and < 85 years
- Post-operative lumbar fusion surgery
- Currently resides within 100 miles of UMC
Exclusion Criteria
- Pregnant
- Pacemaker
- Medications that have heat or light-sensitivity contraindications (such as: steroids, some antibiotics)
- Two or more cardiac risk factors
- Intraoperative complications
- Wound infection
- Spinal fluid leakage
- Open wound

overall_official.affiliation: University of Toledo Health Science Campus

facility.name: University of Toledo, Health Science Campus
